note.p: Career: Travelled to Holland, England and France; practised as a physician in Stockholm; Director of the State Chemical Laboratory (1683); President of the Collegium Medicum (1698); President of the Bergskollegium (Board of Mines) (1713); amassed a scientific library of 3500 volumes, one of the largest in Sweden
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB; Hunter; SMK
Authority: Altname from Hunter. Precise birth date from DSB
References: Egon H Kodicek and Frank G Young, 'Captain Cook and Scurvy' in NR 1969 vol 24 pp 43-63
